text.p: The Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange said on Tuesday that it was publicly reprimanding Suria Capital Holdings Bhd and Bescorp Industries Bhd for not submitting financial results within three months after their year-ends.

The companies were given an extension of two weeks to April 15 to submit the results "failing which trading in the companies' securities will automatically be suspended until such a time when the preliminary financial statements (are) received," the exchange said in a statement.
The exchange said the companies' failure to submit their results breached listing rules.
The KLSE said it has granted an extension of time for three companies to submit their results -- South East Asia Development Corp Bhd, Multi-Purpose Holdings Bhd and Instangreen Corp Bhd.
"The extension of time was given due to submission requirements of the relevant regulatory authority," the exchange said. The statement did not mention the extension period.
Officials at commercial banking and financial services group Suria, and at construction and infrastructure firm Bescorp, were not immediately available for comment.
